intro: Pedicularis corymbosa var. evrardii, commonly known as the Evrard's monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble a monkey's face. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species among plant enthusiasts and botanists.
